## Purpose

"Know Your Damned Computer" is an interactive educational resource designed specifically for digital humanities students who need to build technical skills for digital research projects.

## Learning Philosophy

We believe that:

- **Technical skills are learnable** - No prior experience required
- **Hands-on practice matters** - Every guide includes exercises
- **Context helps** - Examples come from real DH projects
- **Both platforms matter** - Equal support for Mac and PC users
- **Accessibility is essential** - Screen reader support and keyboard navigation

## Who This Is For

This guide is designed for:

- Digital humanities students with little to no technical background
- Researchers starting digital projects
- Anyone who needs to organize digital research materials
- Students learning command line basics
- Scholars working with digital archives and text analysis

## What You'll Learn

::: {.grid}
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Fundamentals
- File management and organization
- Understanding file paths
- File formats and compression
- Text encoding basics
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Practical Skills
- Command line navigation
- Organizing research files
- Version control concepts
- Cross-platform compatibility
:::
:::
